title: Identifying Common Denominator
text: The fractions have a common denominator, so subtract the numerators and place the sum over the common denominator.
speech: The fractions have a common denominator, so subtract the numerators and place the sum over the common denominator.
pacedSpeech: The fractions have a common denominator, so subtract the numerators and place the sum over the common denominator.

title: Factoring the Numerator
text: The numerator can be factored into $$3\left(m-5\right) \left(m-2\right)$$
speech: The numerator can be factored into  3 times, parentheses m minus 5,  times, parentheses m minus 2,
pacedSpeech: The numerator can be factored into   3 times,  m minus 5,  times,  m minus 2,

title: Factoring the Denominator
text: The denominator can be factored into $$6\left(m-5\right)$$
speech: The denominator can be factored into  6 times, parentheses m minus 5,
pacedSpeech: The denominator can be factored into   6 times,  m minus 5,

title: Simplifying Fraction
text: After replacing the factored parts, what is the simplified form of the fraction?
speech: After replacing the factored parts, what is the simplified form of the fraction?
pacedSpeech: After replacing the factored parts, what is the simplified form of the fraction?
